class_notes:
Title: Taylor Swift vs. The Patriarchy
(Class begins Friday, September 15th.)
Using Taylor Swift as a case study, this class examines the challenges of female artists in the entertainment industry and in the patriarchy. This class will ask questions such as: How does the media frame male and female artists differently? In what way can music challenge cultural structures such as the patriarchy? Through examining the evolution of Taylor Swift and her
music, how does a female artist portray themselves in the eyes of the public? Who holds the power in the music industry and how can female artists intervene in that power structure? How has social media affected
the trajectory of Taylor Swift's career and how is her music both viewed and consumed?
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
